Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of comedy mask. Lower jaw missing. Mould-made. White coating covered with pink paint. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with red surface or slip. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis Terracottas workshop that was operational between the 3rd and the 2nd century BC and possibly later. 4th to 2nd century BC parallels (Fischer 1994, pl.27, nos 319 and 324, pl.28, no.336), though closer parallels dated late 3rd century BC to mid 2nd century BC are from Naukratis (British Museum GR 1886,0401.1409, GR1409, 1886,04, Bailey 2008, no.3565; Cambridge MCA NA349). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-Römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.320) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 96, nos 321-324)
